Class ImageProcessing

java.lang.Object
java.util.concurrent.FutureTask<V>
javafx.concurrent.Task<javafx.scene.image.Image>
Main.ImageProcessing
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, java.util.concurrent.Future<javafx.scene.image.Image>, java.util.concurrent.RunnableFuture<javafx.scene.image.Image>, javafx.concurrent.Worker<javafx.scene.image.Image>, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class ImageProcessing
extends javafx.concurrent.Task<javafx.scene.image.Image>
An Encompassing class that runs the image processing in a seperate thread to the JAVAFX UI

  • Constructor Details

    • ImageProcessing

      public ImageProcessing​(javafx.scene.image.Image image, int[] pixels, int width, int height, double noiseFilter, java.lang.String name, javafx.scene.paint.Color color, boolean newGroup)

  • Method Details

    • call

      protected javafx.scene.image.Image call()
      This method provides the processing for the image. It groups together all nearby pixels into disjoint sets. It then removes any groups less than the noisefilter size. It adds these groups to a component group and marks all their extremities. It also adds in the corresponding array into the component group. This component group is then saved to a hashmap in the image controller.
      Specified by:
      call in class javafx.concurrent.Task<javafx.scene.image.Image>
      Returns:
      An image with boxes drawn around valid groups
